summary: Rebecca A. Rife was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are certification reports and payroll certifications that list her position, annual salary, and pay period earnings. These documents span from May to November 1978, indicating her employment with the committee during that period. The documents do not specify her exact role within the HSCA, but they confirm her status as a paid employee.
significance: Rebecca A. Rife's significance lies in her employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations. While the documents do not detail her specific contributions, her presence on payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the committee's work during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
